title: ​Here's How Dating Apps May Be Helping NBA Players Win More Games
text:
Privacy Policy | About Us 
"It's absolutely true that you get at least two hours more sleep getting laid on the road today versus 15 years ago," an unnamed former All-Star told ESPN. "No schmoozing. No going out to the club. No having to get something to eat after the club but before the hotel." 
The article also points out that, before a player is even in his next city, he can DM someone on social media, make arrangements with the hotel to provide them with keys, and then meet them basically as soon as they touch down. 
As such, players are less inclined to go out and drink, which, in the past, would adversely affect their performance the next day. The article also cites concerns about the watchful eye of social media; the integration of better nutritional strategies and travel schedules; and greater attention to personal branding as reasons why players just don't go out as much as they used to, and why life on the road is less exhausting than it once was. 
So, maybe, finally, we have a better understanding of why the Warriors blew a 3-1 lead? After all, they did play Game 7 at home...
